chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert B McGeough was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentences Mr. McGeough to 20 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 8 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith.

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--Court authorizes deduction from prison account for payment of fees and costs

Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

--No Contact with K.M.D. or members of her immediate family unless KMD, both her parents agree if she is still a minor, and Agent agree after Defendant's release from prison
--The defendant shall have no presence at K.M.D.s residence, school or any other place temporarily occupied by her
--No contact with minors
--The defendant shall undergo a psychosexual evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Sex Offender Registry and reporting
--To pay up to $10,000 for any future costs of counseling, psychological or psychiatric care costs for K.M.D.
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency: Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:08 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Robert B McGeough in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement; Counsel indicate there are no factual disputes with PSI - Sentencing Arguments by ADA Beck; Statement of June Drachenfels read by ADA Beck
Sentencing Arguments Atty Svehlek; Statement of Defendant's daughter read by Atty Svehlek; Statements by Elizabeth McGeough; Statements by Robert McGeough

Court sentences Mr. McGeough to 20 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 8 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 394 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--No Contact with K.M.D. or members of her immediate family unless KMD, both her parents agree if she is still a minor, and Agent agree after Defendant's release from prison
--The defendant shall have no presence at K.M.D.s residence, school or any other place temporarily occupied by her
--No contact with minors
--The defendant shall undergo a psychosexual evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Sex Offender Registry and reporting
--To pay up to $10,000 for any future costs of counseling, psychological or psychiatric care costs for K.M.D.
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--Court authorizes deduction from prison account for payment of fees and costs

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 10:31 am
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 2:06pm [mo]
Defendant Robert B McGeough in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.


Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. McGeough guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Atty. Svehlek requests a Pre Sentence Investigation report to be completed prior to sentencing
--No Objection from ADA Teuber

The Court orders the DOC prepare a Pre Sentence Investigation report.

The Court revokes bail; the Defendant must remain in custody until sentencing of this case. 
recess: 2:20pm

NEXT: Sentencing--September 10, 2015 at 9:00am((allow 1 1/2 hours))
Motion hearing on June 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Final status/scheduling conference on June 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Proposed stip and order to change time of hearing

Case called at 2:51pm [mo]
Defendant Robert B McGeough in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   DA Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On the State's 3/4/15 Notice of Audiovisual Recording of Child's Statements
--Atty. Svehlek objects and gives reasoning
--DA Happ gives arguments

The Court reviews statutes related to Audiovisual Recording of Child's Statements
The Court does admit the Audovisual Recording of the Child's Statements
The Court notes that are two DVD's on file that appear to be the same video
DA Happ requests that both of the DVD's be sealed.
The Court orders that both of the DVD's be sealed due to the sensitive nature and age of victim
recess: 3:09am

Case called at 8:35am[Clerk MO]
Defendant Robert B McGeough in court, in custody, with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of Information admitted; reading is waived

Reserve Judge Klossner presiding for Branch IV:  
case called at 8:32am. {MK]
Defendant Robert B McGeough in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

After Mr. McGeough expresses concern about his full understanding for the Waiver-of-Preliminary-Hearing form, the Court reads the form to Mr. McGeough, verifying section by section that Mr. McGeough understands the factors.
Mr. McGeough waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Attorney Svehlek acknowledges service of the Information and asks that Arraignment be scheduled in approximately 30 days.
recess 8:38am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:59 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert B McGeough in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that they are not contesting examiner's findings & requests the Court adopt examiner's findings
DA Happ: Reviewed file and notes, no legal basis to question the examiner's conclusions
Court presents basis, confirms probable cause finding, finds Mr. McGeough incompetent and orders him committed to DHS, with 45 days credit 
Court endorses order as submitted
Recess: 2:06 pm
Competency hearing on September 26, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Competency hearing on October 3, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Order for Competency Examination by DHS

Case called at 9:46 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing)
Defendant Robert B McGeough in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek raises competency, presents basis
Court finds probable cause and orders competency exam, report to be filed in 30 days
Court endorses order as submitted and prepared by Clerk, with no objection from counsel
Court extends deadlines for preliminary hearing

NEXT: Competency Hearing 10/3/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

[Clerk KG]
Case called at 1:21 pm.  

Defendant Robert B McGeough in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Court has reviewed the Criminal Complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.

Court requires $10,000 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with any person idientified in the Criminal Complaint
-No presence at K.M.D.'s residence or any place temporarily occupied by K.M.D.
-No physical contact with any person under the age of 18
-The defendant shall not be alone with any person under the age of 18

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.

Recess:  1:32 pm

NEXT: 
Preliminary Hearing- 08-22-14 at 8:30 am
